com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface repriceOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface repriceOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document repriceOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The repriceOrder API takes the input XML file of an order.

    • Method Detail

      • repriceOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document repriceOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException

        The repriceOrder API takes the input XML file of an order. The order is passed on to the OrderRepricingUE and price changes are applied to the order. If the OrderRepricingUE is not enabled, the enhanced pricing engine is used instead. If the enhanced pricing engine is used, pricing for the order will be determined if the order's pricing date (determined by the DATE_TO_USE_FOR_PRICING rule) is different than any of the line's PricingDate. If this is the case, the entire order will be repriced. If not, then the order will not be repriced. This can be overridden by the ForceReprice attribute.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        The repriceOrder API will call the com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSOrderRepricingUE user exit.

        If ValidateExternalCoupons flag is passed in input, the following User Exit may be invoked.

        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSValidateExternalPromotionsUE


        Additional user exit may be called internally via getOrderPrice API. Refer to getOrderPrice API for more details.
        Events Raised:
        These events are raised under base transaction ORDER_CHANGE.

        ON_SUCCESS:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of the repriceOrder API.
          Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Template Support - Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to the xml for element level details.

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
        N/A.

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions:
        The order must already exist in the system.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Additional Information

        Enhanced Order Pricing

        Pricing an order will be determined by the pricing engine that is in use (based on the USE_DEPRECATED_PRICING_ENGINE rule). If the deprecated pricing engine is in use, repriceOrder will not change prices. If the enhanced pricing engine is used and the YFSOrderRepricingUE is not implemented, pricing for the lines and charges will be determined based on the new pricing engine (see getOrderPrice API for more details). If YFSOrderRepricingUE is implemented, then the user exit will be invoked to determine the prices for the lines.

        Pricing Date

        The date to use to determine the prices for the items and which rules to run will be based on the DATE_TO_USE_FOR_PRICING rule. A draft order will have its items priced based on the current system date. For confirmed orders, its items can be priced based on the current system date or based on the OrderDate. If an order date of type PRICING_DATE exists on the order, then that order date's ActualDate will be used as the pricing date on the order.

        Pricing Address

        The address to determine the region for pricing will be determined based on the customer on the order. If the customer is of type Business (01), then the sold to address on the order will be used if it exists. If it doesn't exist, the Billing Address on the order will be used. For all other customer types, the Billing Address will be used always.

        Shipping Charge

        The shipping charge on the order (determined by the header charge that corresponds to the CHARGE_NAME_FOR_SHIPPING rule) will be used to determine the shipping pricing rules to apply. If pricing determines the shipping charge, a header charge will be applied to the order using the charge name defined in the rule mentioned above.

        Pricing Rules Applied

        When a pricing rule is applied to an order, a charge will be placed on the order or order line for the rule's configured ChargeCategory and ChargeName combination. If multiple pricing rules apply the same charge on the same level (order or order line), the amounts will be totaled to create one charge for that level. For each pricing rule applied, an Award will also be created determining how much was applied due to the pricing rule. If a pricing rule is applied due to a promotion, the PromotionId we be stamped on the Award.

        Manual Pricing Rules

        Manual pricing rules are applied to the order in the same fashion as a coupon. However, the PromotionGroup that it belongs to is MANUAL instead of COUPON. Manual pricing rules can be provided on the order with an override adjustment. This overrides the default value of the pricing rule to provide the abilitiy to give a larger discount to the customer.
        *

        Free Gift Awards

        When a free gift pricing rule is applied to an order, an Award will be applied with IsFreeGiftAward="Y". If a free gift pricing rule cannot apply to a line on the order, and cannot automatically create a line, it will create a header-level adjustment with AwardApplied="N", AwardAmount="0.0", and DenialReason="YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED". To apply the rule to an item, call changeOrder passing the item, and Award element including the AwardId of the header-level award and IsFreeGiftAward="Y". If a free gift line is not returned by pricing, it will not be applied to the order. If a free gift line is manually removed, a header-level award will be created with DenialReason="YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_REMOVED_MANUALLY". This prevents lines from being automatically added for that rule thereafter. See getOrderPrice for more details on Free Gift adjustments.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document having latest order details and the audit details made to the order on the platform. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
